neighborhood_overview:
Back Bay is a vibrant and iconic neighborhood known for its affluent shopping and dining destinations along Newbury Street, featuring designer boutiques, art galleries, and patio cafes set in charming brick townhouses. In addition to its bustling atmosphere, Back Bay offers a peaceful escape with tree-lined streets in nearby Marlborough and Beacon.

Conveniently located, Back Bay provides easy access to many of Boston's popular destinations, including Cambridge, the South End, and cultural institutions like the Boston Public Library and Symphony Hall. The Green and Orange lines are just steps away, and the area is also easily walkable, making it a prime location for residents.

When it comes to dining and drinking, Back Bay has a diverse range of options to choose from. The Prudential Center is home to a variety of bars and restaurants, including Etaly and Cheesecake Factory. Thortons, located in the same building, is a popular breakfast spot. Tatte Bakery & Cafe of

neighborhood_overview:
Explore the city where the new and the old are in constant conversation, where cobbled-stone streets meet glass-enclosed shopping galleries, where The Freedom Trail landmarks stand beside cutting edge restaurants and renowned performance theatres brush shoulders with trendy nightclubs.
You can feast on some of the country's best dim sum in Chinatown, then walk 15 minutes and be at a brewery by the water. You can go spend an afternoon at a world-renowned art museum and wind up at a Sox game that night or start your day strolling the Harvard University campus and end the day taking in a concert at the legendary House of Blues.
Shopping is great fun in Boston. A prime spot for visitors is Faneuil Hall Marketplace and Quincy Market (15 min drive). Faneuil Hall has a large open plaza where kiosks sell gifts and souvenirs and street performers entertain everyone who ambles through. neighborhood_overview:
Allston is a vibrant and young town within the city of Boston. It is a 15 minute drive from the famous baseball park in Fenway, the Green Monster. Boston University is within Allston and Harvard University is just 10 to 15 minute away as well as MIT. Allston is surrounded by famous universities and other exciting spots. The Bruins team practice at the Bruins Ice Arena and the Celtics practice in their own facility all in Boston Landing, just a 5 minute walk from the house.
The neighborhood is packed with diverse restaurants and shops. You can find an incredible amount of food, from Japanese to Thai to Indian to Italian to Latin cusine, and much more. There are several bars, comfort food spots, and club and Kareoke spots all within walking distance.

neighborhood_overview:
Dorchester is a historic neighborhood of over 6 square miles. Boston's largest neighborhood by far, is today sometimes nicknamed "Dot" by its residents. It is also arguably the cityâ€™s most diverse, home to nearly a quarter of the cityâ€™s population, including Irish, Polish, Vietnamese, and African American residents, as well as a large Caribbean and Cape Verdean community. Founded in 1630, months before the establishment of Boston, it is also steeped in history.

host_about:
Hello! We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!  

When Covid struck our world, we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit, please let us know prior to booking! 

We hope we get the chance to host you!

neighborhood_overview:
What kind of neighborhood is Dorchester MA?
Dorchester is famously accessible and is Boston largest neighborhood. It is also arguably the city's most diverse, home to nearly a quarter of the city's population, including Irish, Polish, Vietnamese, and African American residents, as well as a large Caribbean and Cape Verdean community. In Boston overall Its diverse population and size mean youâ€™ll find a wide range of neighborhoods for every budget and lifestyle. Dorchester MA offers trendy and historic destinations, a thriving arts community, waterfront amenities, and excellent public transit â€“ not to mention a fun nightlife scene and amazing restaurants.

name: (5G2) Beautiful Duplex, W/D, Best Location!
description: Beautiful Back Bay, corner of Newbury Street, across from the Prudential/ Copley Mall, a short walk to the Boston Commons and more!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the elegant and lively Back Bay neighborhood!

Newbury street is 8 beautiful blocks filled with salons, boutiques, and fabulous dining. Bostonâ€™s Newbury Street has something for everyone! Shops include designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. There are endless options for breakfast, brunch, lunch & dinner just steps outside of your door!

Visit expansive Copley Square!
Located a 4 minute walk from the unit, Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. In the Spring, Summer & Fall, you will find an incredible farmers market lined with local vendors! If your lucky, you could also catch a community concert!

Take a stroll and admire Back Bay!
Boston Common & Boston Garden date all the way back to 1634, this is actually the oldest city park in the country! The Common & Garden make for the perfect place for a stroll, located just 1.5 mi
host_about:
Hello! We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!  

When Covid struck our world, we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in the North End, a bustling historic district with rich colonial history. Minutes away from downtown, it is favored by young professionals looking for a short commute and go-to eateries. This neighborhood is a foodie favorite as it offers an endless array of restaurants, bakeries and cafes and serves as the de facto â€œLittle Italyâ€ in Boston. Visit Haymarket, the famed farmerâ€™s stand outside the historic Faneuil Hall for some fresh products or attend a Boston Celtics or Boston Bruins game at TD Bank Arena. During the evenings, Christopher Columbus Park is ideal for walks along the neighboring harbor waterfront. Home to North Station, one of the most diverse transit hubs in the city, Boston Commons and South Station are a quick ten minute train ride away. The Financial district is just a short walk away.

name: Beacon Hill: The Aldrich House
description:
Brief Introduction
This is a wonderful opportunity to rent this iconic residence built in 1837 atop picturesque Mount Vernon Street in Beacon Hill, one of Boston's most prestigious neighborhoods. Preserved with Historic New England, it is also historically significant as the home of Thomas Bailey Aldrich, editor of the Atlantic Monthly and a renowned author and poet. Aldrich transformed this space into a hub for the intellectual elite, contributing to the cultural fabric of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
One of Boston's most picturesque areas. Beacon Hill has steep streets lined with Federal-style and Victorian brick row houses lit by antique lanterns. The gold-domed Massachusetts State House overlooks Boston Common, with its winter skating pond. Across Charles Street, home to chic boutiques and antique shops, is the formal Public Garden. The Charles River Esplanade's Hatch Shell hosts summer concerts.


Welcome MGH families (5-minute walk to MGH)

neighborhood_overview:
What kind of neighborhood is Dorchester MA?
Dorchester is famously accessible and is Boston largest neighborhood. It is also arguably the city's most diverse, home to nearly a quarter of the city's population, including Irish, Polish, Vietnamese, and African American residents, as well as a large Caribbean and Cape Verdean community. In Boston overall Its diverse population and size mean youâ€™ll find a wide range of neighborhoods for every budget and lifestyle. Dorchester MA offers trendy and historic destinations, a thriving arts community, waterfront amenities, and excellent public transitâ€“ not to mention a fun nightlife scene and amazing restaurants.

name: Gorgeous Victorian House in JP
description: Experience historic charm in this stunning 5BR Victorian house in Jamaica Plain. Enjoy easy access to public transportation while staying in a large beautifully preserved home with all the modern amenities. Step back in time with high ceilings, original moldings & antique details including 4 different patterns of parquet flooring, combined with updated kitchen & baths for a unique stay in a desirable location.
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a vibrant neighborhood in Boston, known for its diverse community and abundance of local amenities. Some of the highlights of the area include Franklin Park and Arnold Arboretum, one of the largest parks in Boston, offering a wide range of outdoor activities and recreational opportunities. For grocery shopping, there is a Whole Foods store, providing access to high-quality, natural and organic foods. Foodies will enjoy the diverse array of dining options within 8 blocks of the apartment, including Ula Cafe and Evergreen, both known for their delicious brunch options and cozy atmosphere, and the Brendan Behan bar, a popular spot for drinks and live music. The neighborhood is also home to many fantastic restaurants, offering a range of cuisine from all over the world. host_about:

One life. Live it. 
Patrick

name: The Heart of Southie (Garage + Roof Deck)
description:
Beautiful, brand new condo located in the heart of South Boston. Steps away from the best restaurants, bars and nightlife Southie has to offer. Boston Convention Center and Flynn Cruiseport are less than a mile away. Very close to Seaport and downtown.

Third floor unit includes a private parking garage and large roof deck that has amazing views of Boston harbor. The popular Carson (M street) beach is a short walk away. Thomas Park also has some of the best skyline views the city has to offer.
neighborhood_overview:
Known by locals simply as Southie, South Boston is a large neighborhood located just outside of downtown and borders the Seaport. This former blue-collar neighborhood has rapidly grown into the most sought after neighborhood for adults in their 20s and 30s due to the extremely popular restaurants, bars and nightlife.

South Boston has a lot more to offer than just that. Castle Island anchors a 3 mile stretch of South Boston beaches and is perfect for a lazy day on the beach or a scenic walk overlooking the Boston Harbor Islands. Youâ€™ll never get sick of the views from atop Thomas Park (located 100 yards from unit). This former revolutionary war monument sits high above the neighborhood and offers incredible views of the sunset and 4th of July fireworks.

name: Spacious & Stylish 4-BR w/ 4-BA Apt near DT
description: Welcome to our beautifully decorated and amenity-rich 4 bedroom, 4 bathroom unit! Enjoy the comfort of a well-furnished space, designed to cater to your every need for a hassle-free stay. Ideally situated, our unit offers easy access to Boston's attractions, universities, hospitals, the airport, and more. Whether you're here for leisure or work, this luxurious retreat promises a memorable experience. Book now for a delightful stay in a location that perfectly blends comfort with convenience.
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is officially located in the Dorchester neighborhood of Boston, but it sits right on the border with Roxbury. Both areas are predominantly residential, while also being conveniently close to downtown Boston.

Explore Dorchester, Boston's largest and oldest neighborhood and home to the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library & Museum, Franklin Park Zoo, the Edward M. Kennedy Institute for the US Senate and Commonwealth Museum. Delicious restaurants such as 224 Boston Street Restaurant, dbar, and the Freeport Tavern also call Dorchester home.

Roxbury celebrates community culture through visual and performance arts at the Roxbury Center and the Museum of the National Center for African-American Artists. Nubian Square is a dynamic intersection of public art, retail shops, bookstores, eclectic cafes and restaurants. The creative economy is alive in Roxbury, and the neighborhood itself is both a canvass for artistic expression and an incubator of those energies.

name: Lovely 3 bedroom 2 bath â€œ6 miles from downtownâ€
description:
Central Dorchester is located about 5 miles south of downtown Boston, which is approximately a 15-20 minute drive or a 25-30 minute subway ride on the Red Line.

Fenway Park, which is located in the Fenway-Kenmore neighborhood of Boston, is approximately 6 miles northeast of Dorchester. It is about a 20-25 minute drive or a 30-35 minute subway ride on the Red Line.

TD Garden, which is located in the West End neighborhood of Boston, is approximately 7 miles north of Dorchester.
neighborhood_overview:
Central Dorchester is a predominantly residential area, with a mix of single-family homes and multi-unit buildings. The architecture of the neighborhood is diverse, with a range of styles including Victorian, Queen Anne, and Colonial Revival.

There are several parks and green spaces in the neighborhood, including Franklin Park and the Arnold Arboretum. These parks offer recreational opportunities such as jogging, walking, and picnicking.

Central Dorchester is also home to a number of schools, including the John F. Kennedy Elementary School, the Lilla G. Frederick Middle School, and the Boston Collegiate Charter School.

The neighborhood is served by several public transportation options, including the MBTA's Red Line and bus routes. There are also numerous shops, restaurants, and other amenities in the area, making it a convenient and vibrant place to live.

neighborhood_overview:
The property is in a lively neighborhood of Dorchester. Very family oriented and outdoorsy. Lots of schools nearby such as Boston Latin Academy. Part of the charm of the place is the diversity. Right next door is an apartment complex with budding students, clacking away on their laptops. Every multi family building seems to have a backyard and ample parking space.

You'll often see students walk on the street. It's right off Columbia Road one of the Main Streets of Dorchester, a prime location for food, public transportation, and diversity.

Dorchester has had a very rich history. What's different about Dorchester in the Boston Area is the plethora of African appeal and civil rights background. Less than 5 mins walk, visit Elegance African Fashions for some true traditional African couture and patterns.

A 15 minute walk to Blue Hill Ave lands you in the smack middle of the Malcom X, MLK history.

Or pivot to The Grove Hall Public Library and ch
host_about:
I graduated college in 2017 with a chemistry degree. During college, I picked up a part time job as a houseman in my schoolâ€™s hotel, less so for the money. More so to look busy. It was initially meant to be a past time, but one particular night left a mark I never forgot.

The job required me to assist the housekeepers. I was the grease to a well-maintained machine. Take off the bed sheets, remove the used soaps and towels, and empty the trash. You do that to every room. Simple right?

It was the last night for an opposing schoolâ€™s football team and my manager needed someone to clean up after them and then prepare the rooms for the next working day.

I showed up and cleared every room assigned to me. I thought nothing of it and went back to my dorm. The next day, I went back to work on my regular shift. 

To my surprise, everyone came up to me to thank me for making their day a hundred times easier. I was happy for a moment. But then I scratched my head thinking to myself, â€œyou all know that Iâ€™m getting paid for this right?â€

But then it dawned on me. I was looking at this experience through broken glasses.

Hospitality is as much a human experience for the guests as it is for the people who make that experience worthwhile. 

That day has inspired to me to strive to make every experience worthwhile. My goal is to facilitate wonderful experiences for people around the world. Hopefully, hosting on Airbnb will be the catalyst for my guests to make fun, happy, and joyful memories.

name: Boston Marathon Paradise!
description: Our 19th-century Victorian home is the perfect place to relax and enjoy all that Boston has to offer. If you are running in the Boston Marathon, this reservation includes 2 bus tickets to the starting line in Hopkinton! Roslindale is a quiet neighborhood in Boston with public transportation, restaurants, a grocery store, and lovely parks only a short walk away.
neighborhood_overview:
The historic Village of Roslindale is a residential neighborhood of Boston that has much to offer. The world-famous Arnold Arboretum is steps away and there is easy access to bike paths going into the city or out to the country.
Roslindale Square hosts the best farmer's market in the area, as well as shops from boutiques to Target. The commuter train to Back Bay and South Station runs through the center and T stations are a short bus ride away. Roslindale is a diverse and safe neighborhood and (in our opinion) the best neighborhood in Boston.
host_about: We are a family of four that loves to travel. My husband and I lived in Barcelona for a year and our boys have been there twice. We both work in the field of education. Our favorite thing to do when traveling is to wander around a neighborhood and find delicious things to eat.

name: Charming New England Artist House
description: Have fun with the whole family at this stylish, spacious  and unique house. Colorful and fun artist's 3-story home with 3 private bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and ample living room, dining room and kitchen, along with a huge backyard in the Jamaica Plain/Egleston Square neighborhood in Boston. The 1850's era private house is about an 8-10 minute walk to the train station (orange line to the Stonybrook stop), walking distance to great cafes, restaurants and 3 minutes to glorious Franklin Park.
neighborhood_overview:
Our area is the Jamaica Plain/Roxbury neighborhood also known as Egleston Square. We are about a block and a half to Franklin Park (part of Olmsteads emerald necklace) a five minute walk to the Franklin Park zoo, an 8-10 minute walk to the Stonybrook T stop (Bostonâ€™s subway) along with a 5 minute walk to Ula Cafe and the famous Sam Adams brewery.

Please note that while our house is somewhat suburbanâ€”-we live in an urban area. Please use your caution walking late at night as you would in any city. Our neighbors look out for each other and this is a tight knit block. You might feel like youâ€™re in the country as the backyard is super private and there are flowers and plants galore â€”(and the street is super quiet as it dead ends to a community garden) but Boston is a city and you should use your street smarts. The neighborhood is constantly changing and we feel lucky to live here.
host_about: Animators, artists, and local professors. We have an animation studio called Goose and Hummingbird. Check us out: www.gooseandhummingbird.com

neighborhood_overview:
Even though Savin Hill is part of Bostonâ€™s biggest neighborhood, it is sometimes overlooked by other Bostonians. Those of us who know about the areaâ€™s historic buildings, art galleries, bars, and restaurants are not in a hurry to tell everybody else. Savin Hill is a vibrant mix of young professionals and artists, close enough to downtown to make getting around Boston a breeze, but with enough happening in your immediate environs that you donâ€™t need to go far to discover why our neighborhood is truly a hidden gem.

All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.

We welcome you to the lovely, central, and desirable Bay Village neighborhood, in the heart of the city. Beautiful, quiet neighborhood. Just a 5 minute walk to Copley, Boston Commons, Boston Public Garden, Newbury Street, Prudential Center, all of the dining & shopping in Back Bay, Chinatown, & more!

Spanning just six square blocks, Bay Village is Bostonâ€™s smallest official neighborhood. Bay Village is regarded as a hidden gem, surrounded by powerhouse neighbors like Chinatown, Back Bay, the South End, and Downtown. Bay Village is also the birthplace of literary great Edgar Allan Poe, whose memory lives on at Edgar Allan Poe Square on Boylston Street and Charles Street South.

neighborhood_overview:
Dorchester is a historic neighborhood of over 6 square miles. Boston's largest neighborhood by far, is today sometimes nicknamed "Dot" by its residents. It is also arguably the cityâ€™s most diverse, home to nearly a quarter of the cityâ€™s population, including Irish, Polish, Vietnamese, and African American residents, as well as a large Caribbean and Cape Verdean community. Founded in 1630, months before the establishment of Boston, it is also steeped in history.

Things to Do:
- Joseph Finnegan Park
- Pope John Paul Park
- John F. Kennedy Presidential Library & Museum
- Franklin Park Zoo
- Edward M. Kennedy Institute for the US Senate
- Commonwealth Museum
- Strand Theater
- Boston Bowl
- Tenean Beach and Park

Stop for A Drink or a Bite:

- 224 Boston Street Restaurant
- Dbar

host_about:
Hello! We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!  

When Covid struck our world, we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit, please let us know prior to booking! 

We hope we get the chance to host you!

name: Single Family Boston House Great Privacy
description:
My family has been living in this single family house for about 5 years and has been really enjoying it; now we are moving to countryside in Metro Boston and turning this house into AirBnB, and we would like our guests enjoy staying in this house just as much as we did.

The house has about ~2610 sq ft.

2nd floor/walkout basement: 5 bedrooms with king/king/queen/queen/full size beds, 3.5 bathrooms (2 private).

3 decks and enclosed private large backyard.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is in the Brook Farm neighborhood, which is probably the best, safest, and most suburb like neighborhood in the city of Boston.

This house is especially private with super quiet and nice neighbors. The backyard has a much higher elevation than the next street.

Fully fenced backyard with well maintained grass.

No buses passing the street, but two bus stops on other streets just one or two blocks away.

Allow me to introduce myself, my name is Ping and I welcome you to our newly renovated apartment! 

If there is anything I would like to share, it would be my love for food. I especially have an fondness for coffee and tea in particular. There is nothing more relaxing and calming then to read an book while enjoying an cup of coffee.

Welcome to the vibrant heart of Boston's Back Bay! Our neighborhood is not only picturesque but also brimming with life and energy. Here's what you can expect:

host_about:
Hello! We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!  

When Covid struck our world, we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit, please let us know prior to booking! 

We hope we get the chance to host you!

neighborhood_overview:
But the beauty of our neighborhood isn't confined to the exquisite Victorian homes alone. The entire area is a paradise for nature enthusiasts and photography enthusiasts alike. Lush, manicured gardens burst with vibrant blooms during the spring and summer months, creating a kaleidoscope of colors against the backdrop of historic architecture.

For those who appreciate the changing seasons, autumn transforms the neighborhood into a canvas of warm, fiery hues as the leaves gracefully fall, creating a scene straight out of a fairytale. Winter brings a serene charm, with snow-dusted rooftops and twinkling holiday lights that make evening walks simply magical.

description: Charming & spacious 2-level 1-bedroom Apt walk to Longwood Medical area hospitals. The highest in the neighborhood, offers stunning views of Boston skyline from both Living room & Balcony. Hardwood floor, Granite counter. 5 minutes walk to a train station that take you anywhere in the city. Restaurants, grocery store, & Walgreen are within 10 minutes walk. Universities and colleges like Northeastern, Wentworth, Massart, and MCPHS, and numerous museums (of Fine Arts) are all in walking distance.
neighborhood_overview:
This one bedroom apartment is 2 floors in a building located at the top of Mission Hill. The Mission Park subway station is a 5 minute walk down the hill, and will take you anywhere in the city.

There are many restaurants and bars nearby, in addition to Stop & Shop (grocery store), Walgreens (drugstore), Boston staple Dunkin' Donuts, JP Licks ice cream shop, TGI Friday's, and Boston's Basilica, a soaring landmark of the city, just down the hill.

There are multiple museums within walking distance: Museum of Fine Arts, MassArt Art Museum, Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, and more.

Universities and college campuses like Northeastern, Wentworth, MassArt, and MCPHS are nearby.

Fenway Park is only 9 minutes car ride from this apartment.

name: Roomy 4bed loft | Family Friendly
neighborhood_overview:
Just steps from the Boston Common, this neighborhood has had many personalities over the decades! Since the early 1900s, the area along Washington and Tremont Streets, roughly from School Street to Beach Street, has also been referred to as the Ladder District. Now it is most commonly named Downtown Crossing as most of the city's Subway's or (T-lines) intersect at Park Street station. The MBTA's Downtown Crossing subway station directly serves Downtown Crossing. The State Street and Park Street stations are within close walking distance. Silver Line service is also available. You can get literally anywhere in the city for a few dollars and a Tpass.

The apartment building is located on a dead end street which means it's super quiet for automobile traffic, but still has the lively city feel as foot traffic is sure to be noticeable any time of day, even in the winter. The Boston Common is only a few hundred feet from the entrance to the building.

Important to note is
host_about: Healing Homes of Boston's mission it to provide clean, comfortable, furnished stays for patients + families visiting Boston for treatment.  We run a hybrid business model, providing corporate relocation, institutional and business stays, as well as travel nurse housing.  We're a small team but we have big goals!  If you're booking for a non-medical stay, a portion of your dollars support our non-profit partners.  We look forward to hosting you!

name: Luxury 2BR 2BA South end Boston Balcony
(FB2) Fenway 3 Brm, W/D Near Hospitals!
description: Welcome to Fenway, Boston! Stay in the heart of the city's sports and cultural hub, right by iconic Fenway Park. Our neighborhood offers easy access to Back Bay, with its upscale shopping on Newbury Street. Plus, top hospitals like Brigham and Women's and Beth Israel Deaconess are nearby for added convenience. Enjoy a vibrant, well-connected stay in the heart of Boston!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Fenway, Boston! Choosing to stay with us in this dynamic neighborhood offers several compelling reasons:

Proximity to Fenway Park: Sports enthusiasts can't get any closer to the action! Catch a Red Sox game or take a stadium tour just steps away.

Cultural Attractions: Immerse yourself in Boston's culture with nearby institutions like the Museum of Fine Arts and the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum.

Diverse Dining: Explore a diverse culinary scene, from classic ballpark fare to upscale dining options and international cuisines, all within walking distance.
Green Spaces: Enjoy the lush greenery of the Emerald Necklace park system, perfect for leisurely strolls and picnics.

Public Transportation: Easy access to the T (subway) and major transit hubs, making it a breeze to explore the rest of Boston.

Historical Charm: Discover the historic Fenway Victory Gardens and the neighborhood's unique architecture.

Enter
host_about:
Hello! We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!  

When Covid struck our world, we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit, please let us know prior to booking! 

We hope we get the chance to host you!

neighborhood_overview:
- Centrally located in Boston's historic Beacon Hill on the most popular destination in Beacon Hill (the condo is located on Charles Street), our condo sits steps away from fantastic boutiques and excellent restaurants. Our historic Beacon Hill brownstone is located only a few blocks from the serene Boston Commons and Public Gardens, the Charles River Esplanade, MGH, and the Freedom Trail.

- One of Boston's oldest communities and likely Boston's best known neighborhood, Beacon Hill gets its name from a beacon that once stood atop its hill to warn locals about foreign invasion. Approximately one square mile in size, Beacon Hill is bound by Beacon Street, Bowdoin Street, Cambridge Street and Storrow Drive. Its architecture and layout is reflective of old colonial Boston, consisting of brick row houses with beautiful doors, decorative iron work, brick sidewalks, narrow streets, and gas lamps. Beacon Hill is home to the Massachusetts State House. Charles Street, the neighborho
host_about:
I live in the Back Bay and I'm happy to accommodate any unique requests. 

Our properties are available to business professionals seeking short-term corporate housing and families visiting Boston area hospitals.  Please inquire about our special rates for those associated with Shriners, MGH, BWH,  BIDMC, and Mass Eye and Ear. 

My large family are all long-time Boston residents, and most of the members still own apartments from when they lived in downtown Boston.  All of my condo's are owned by members of my family.

Prior to my current job at an investment consulting and advisory firm, where I focus on identifying top-tier real estate managers for our clients to invest in, I worked for a small firm managing a Saudi Prince's hotel investments across North America and Europe.  We managed his interests in the Four Seasons and Fairmont, as well as oversaw his investments in several trophy properties, most notably, NYC's The Plaza; Paris' Four Seasons Hotel George V; and London's The Savoy.  I have taken the same approach we took at my previous firm to managing our personal real estate investments, by providing exceptional service combined with fantastic accommodations in prime locations.

If you stay with us during the summer months (typically available mid weekdays from the middle of June to Labor Day), we'd love to take you out on our 50-ft yacht for a complimentary afternoon sail and lunch (catered by a restaurant / bar we own) around the Boston Harbor (schedule and availability permitting and limited to guests 16 years and older).

Also feel free to inquire about special rates on massages at Bodywaves - a business my father runs on Hanover St. in Boston's Quincy Market / Faneuil Hall area.

name: Large 2 BR | 1BA in the North End
description: Updated 2 Bedroom | 1 Bath located on the waterfront in the North End is perfectly situated close to everything you want to see and do in Downtown Boston.  This spacious 800 sqft condo is located on the ground floor and offers central A/C, two great bedrooms, a brand new new kitchen that opens to the spacious living room, new bathroom, and hardwood floors!
neighborhood_overview:
The North End is Boston's oldest residential neighborhood and could best be described as the "Little Italy" of Boston. The North End is one of the most visited neighborhoods in the City of Boston and is the hub of the Italian-American community. Itâ€™s character is woven through the neighborhoods narrow yet vibrant streets that boast some of the best restaurants and old world cafes the City has to offer. And there is history too - Old North Church, Paul Revere's house, burial grounds - seemingly around every corner. The North End is walking distance to so many attractions and is in the middle of everything that the North End is the perfect place to call home for your first trip to Boston or for the seasoned executive looking to be close to the Financial District.

With dozens of eateries serving homemade pasta, fresh-baked breads, cannoli and cappuccino, the North End is infused with the flavor of its rich Italian history. Colonial-era sites are located throughout the neigh

name: Spacious Dog Friendly 3bd Apt
description:
This spacious 3 bd apartment is a short drive into Boston proper and walking distance to many local shops, restaurants, and "emerald necklace" parks in the Jamaica Plain/Roxbury area.
With a flexible layout that's great for families or small groups, the master bedroom has a double bed and an additional pullout love seat, the 2nd bedroom is set up with 2 twin beds, with an additional full bed in the 3rd bedroom.
neighborhood_overview:
Egleston Square straddles Jamaica Plain and Roxbury, both vibrant, diverse, residential neighborhoods in the city of Boston. There are lots of great restaurants and shops within walking distance, as well as the Sam Adams brewery. Our one-way street is just off Washington, which will take you directly into the city. Weâ€™re a 5 minute walk from Franklin Park, the largest park in Boston and great for runs or dog walks. Weâ€™re closest to the part where the old zoo used to be (the active zoo is a 10 minute walk further) and there are abandoned bear enclosures from 1905 that are cool to explore.

I want to remind all that you will be in a city that has diverse residents, people of color, and people of various backgrounds, so please be mindful of this and conduct yourself as such. If you equate a diverse neighborhood to an unsafe one, this is not the place for you.

name: Large 2 BR|2 BA + Patio in Back Bay
description: Our recently renovated 2 bedroom garden-level condo on Commonwealth Ave is just steps from Newbury St & the Prudential Center / Hynes. This 1,025 sqft duplex features a private patio, central air, 2 bathrooms, gourmet kitchen, and cable & internet!
neighborhood_overview:
Centrally located in Boston's historic Back Bay on Commonwealth Avenue between Charlesgate East and Massachusetts Avenue, our condo sits within a short five minute walk from the Hynes Convention Center, the Shops at the Prudential Center and Copley Place Mall, and the boutiques of Newbury and Boylston Street. Our historic Back Bay brownstone is located only one and half blocks from the Charles River Esplanade, and several blocks to the serene Boston Commons and Public Gardens, Fenway Park, the Boston Public Library, historic Beacon Hill, and the Freedom Trail. A corner grocery store is steps away from the building and ample amounts of restaurants and shopping are located around the corner.

The Back Bay neighborhood sits on land reclaimed from water in the mid-nineteenth century. Unlike many other Boston neighborhoods, the Back Bay was laid out in a grid pattern and was based on French urban planning with parks and wide boulevards.

The major shopping streets are
host_about:
I live in the Back Bay and I'm happy to accommodate any unique requests. 

Our properties are available to business professionals seeking short-term corporate housing and families visiting Boston area hospitals.  Please inquire about our special rates for those associated with Shriners, MGH, BWH,  BIDMC, and Mass Eye and Ear. 

My large family are all long-time Boston residents, and most of the members still own apartments from when they lived in downtown Boston.  All of my condo's are owned by members of my family.

Prior to my current job at an investment consulting and advisory firm, where I focus on identifying top-tier real estate managers for our clients to invest in, I worked for a small firm managing a Saudi Prince's hotel investments across North America and Europe.  We managed his interests in the Four Seasons and Fairmont, as well as oversaw his investments in several trophy properties, most notably, NYC's The Plaza; Paris' Four Seasons Hotel George V; and London's The Savoy.  I have taken the same approach we took at my previous firm to managing our personal real estate investments, by providing exceptional service combined with fantastic accommodations in prime locations.

If you stay with us during the summer months (typically available mid weekdays from the middle of June to Labor Day), we'd love to take you out on our 50-ft yacht for a complimentary afternoon sail and lunch (catered by a restaurant / bar we own) around the Boston Harbor (schedule and availability permitting and limited to guests 16 years and older).

Also feel free to inquire about special rates on massages at Bodywaves - a business my father runs on Hanover St. in Boston's Quincy Market / Faneuil Hall area.

neighborhood_overview:
- Our brownstone is located right at the intersection of East and West Broadway in South Boston, with easy access to public transportation and walking distance to the Seaport and Downtown Boston. A 7-Eleven / convenience store is located steps away from the building and ample amounts of restaurants and neighborhood shopping are located around the corner.

- Once a predominantly Irish Catholic community, in recent years South Boston has become increasingly desirable among young professionals and families who are attracted to the neighborhood's strong sense of community and quick access to downtown and public transportation. People from all over the city enjoy taking a stroll around Castle Island, a Revolutionary War-era fort and 22-acre park that is connected to the mainland. "Southie Pride" is on full display in March when city residents flock to the neighborhood to enjoy the annual South Boston St. Patrick's Day Parade. name: New Luxury Renovation | near T
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain, known fondly to locals as "JP," is one of the hippest neighborhoods in Boston. The area is known for its amazing green spaces and culinary scene; take a 5 minute walk to the scenic Franklin Park arboretum, or pick up a taco from Chilacates. JP's close proximity to downtown Boston makes this the perfect place for guests who want to explore the city while enjoying the local flavor of this quintessential Bean Town neighborhood.
host_about:
My personal loves include perfecting my Boston clam chowder recipe, traveling as much as I can, and keeping up to date on current events. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about my two favorite cities. I hope I have the chance to show you Boston and New York's amazing energies and vibrant cultures.

Cheers,
Frank

description: Custom Ren. 4 + bed brownstone ideal location in historic Charlestown. Access to "T",  Bunker Hill Monument, Freedom Trail.  Close to Bostonâ€™s North End & Faneuil Hall. This is our private family home.  Kitchen w/Sub zero, Wolfe range, island for 4.  1st fl.-kitchen, living, dining, 1/2 bath, 2nd fl,  master suite, gas fireplace, spa like master w/heated marble flrs, dble. vanity, frameless shower & tub. neighborhood_overview: As Boston's oldest neighborhood, Charlestown is steeped in history. Boston's most popular walk, the Freedom Trail, ends in Charlestown at the Bunker Hill Monument, commemorating the Battle of Bunker Hill which happened in the beginning of the American Revolutionary War. It has cobblestone streets and historic gas lamps and  an ample waterfront. Charlestown is across the Charles and Mystic rivers from the rest of Boston, connected to the North End by the Charlestown Bridge. For public transportation It is located on the orange line w/easy access to all of Boston's neighborhoods.

name: Downtown Designer Home| Keyless
description:
This 4 Bed, 2 Bath fully furnished apartment with Laundry in unit is available for both long and short term rental. With One King Sized bed and 3 Queens, this beautifully designed and furnished loft is located right in downtown Boston. Includes all furnishings and cooking equipment!

The apartment is accessible via a self-check-in process to lower your exposure! Security on-site, and 2 Elevators. Units are professionally cleaned and disinfected between every stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Just steps from the Boston Common, this neighborhood has had many personalities over the decades! Since the early 1900s, the area along Washington and Tremont Streets, roughly from School Street to Beach Street, has also been referred to as the Ladder District. Now it is most commonly named Downtown Crossing as most of the city's Subway's or (T-lines) intersect at Park Street station. The MBTA's Downtown Crossing subway station directly serves Downtown Crossing. The State Street and Park Street stations are within close walking distance. Silver Line service is also available. You can get literally anywhere in the city for a few dollars and a Tpass.

The apartment building is located on a dead end street which means it's super quiet for automobile traffic, but still has the lively city feel as foot traffic is sure to be noticeable any time of day, even in the winter. The Boston Common is only a few hundred feet from the entrance to the building.

Important to note is

Our home is officially located in the Dorchester neighborhood of Boston, but it sits right on the border with Roxbury. Both areas are predominantly residential and offer plenty, while also being conveniently close to downtown Boston.

Explore Dorchester, Boston's largest and oldest neighborhood and home to the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library & Museum, Franklin Park Zoo, the Edward M. Kennedy Institute for the US Senate and Commonwealth Museum. Delicious restaurants such as 224 Boston Street Restaurant, dbar, and the Freeport Tavern also call Dorchester home.

Roxbury celebrates community culture through visual and performance arts at the Roxbury Center and the Museum of the National Center for African-American Artists. Nubian Square is a dynamic intersection of public art, retail shops, bookstores, eclectic cafes and restaurants. neighborhood_overview:
Brighton is an amazing place! It's super close to the city but I think a lot more peaceful. The people are kind mostly working professionals, healthcare workers, and students. There are so many wonderful restaurants around Market Street and the public transport makes it a breeze to get anywhere in the city! Here are some important points of interest for guests

Groceries & Cafeâ€™s
Whole Foods: 0.5 miles, 8 min walk, 4 min car ride
Cafe Nero: 0.4 miles, 8 min walk, 3 min car ride
Brighton Cafe:0.3 miles, 6 min walk, 3 min car ride
Tatte (Upscale Cafe):1.4 miles, 7 min car ride



Points of Interest:

1. Faneuil Hall Marketplace (25 minutes by car or 45 minutes by public transportation): Faneuil Hall Marketplace is a historic spot to enjoy great food and shopping.

2. The North End (20 minutes by car or 45 minutes by public transportation): Some of the best Italian food you could find! Mikes Pastries serves cannolis t

name: Upscale Apt with Private Work From Anywhere Office
neighborhood_overview:
One of the most iconic neighborhoods located at the affluent Back Bay destination is full of shopping and dining places you must visit, along Newbury Street, all locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses.You can walk a few streets over to Marlborough and Beacon to find peaceful, tree-lined streets where the crowds feel miles away.

Staying in Back Bay means quick access to almost any part of the city, whether itâ€™s crossing the bridge to Cambridge or heading to dinner in the South End. The Green and Orange lines are just steps away, but the ability to walk almost anywhere in the city is the real draw for most residents. Access to cultural institutions like the Boston Public Library and Symphony Hall, as well as iconic green spaces like the Boston Public Garden and Commonwealth Mall is an obvious draw that explains why the area has maintained its desirability all the way from the Victorian era to the presen

name: Private deck, Luxury Penthouse, w/d & parking
description: This luxury penthouse in the heart of vibrant Back Bay offers a comfortable home base for travelers looking to experience all that the city has to offer. Surrounded by beautiful brownstone buildings, tree-lined streets, & a bustling shopping and dining scene, & just steps away from popular attractions like Newbury Street, the Prudential Center, and Copley Square. Plus, with world-class museums, historic landmarks, and delicious seafood nearby, you'll have plenty to see and do during your visit.
host_about:
Hello! We are Airbnb Queen! We started hosting a few apartments in 2015 and grew to be a small company with a love for hosting and giving back to our community!  

When Covid struck our world, we were at a standstill! We had to quickly learn and grow to make sure our health and cleaning standards were in line with those of the CDC. We remain dedicated to providing a happy and healthy stay for our amazing guests!

We are partnered with a wonderful non-profit that specializes in providing  housing for families in need of a discounted or free place to stay for the duration of their hospital visits. Most of these stays are for children under going treatment in our amazing Boston Hospitals. We are honored and motivated to helping those in need. If you are here for a hospital related visit, please let us know prior to booking! 

We hope we get the chance to host you!

name: Boston / Red Sox / MFA 23.18
description:
Perfect location in the Fenway neighborhood (Home of the historic Fenway Park and the legendary Boston Red Sox) Beautiful Brownstone home with an elevator, lots of sunlight and the perfect location to get anywhere else in Boston.

Fenway Subway station is a five minute walk. Museum of fine Arts subway station is a ten minute walk. You can walk to the Boston Red Sox game in less than ten minutes.

Fast wifi. Smart TV. Phone APP operated laundry. -
neighborhood_overview: This is the lively Vibrant Fenway neighborhood. The listing is located close to the intersection of Peterborough Street and Kilmarnock Street. On Boylston Street you've got the great restaurants, bars, and cafes. On Park Drive, you've got the serene beautiful park and riverwalk through the Fens Parks and Fens Gardens. Park Drive is beautiful Historic Boston at its finest. Lovely rows of Brownstone homes throughout the neighborhood.
host_about:
Hi, My name is KJ! _x000D_
I have lived in Boston since 2011! Love this city and love to host travelers coming here. I went to Yonsei University in Korea, earned my bachelor's degree in Classical Piano. Then, I moved to Boston and graduated from Boston University in 2013 - got a Master of Music Degree. Boston is now my home and am working as a freelance pianist and sometimes as a tour guide!_x000D_
_x000D_
I love exercising, playing jazz, meeting people, dancing, laying on the beach drinking cold beer, shopping and travel ;)_x000D_
Nice to meet you all!!

name: 2BR BU / Allston / Harvard Ave.
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located place. 2024: Newly renovated with brand new furnishings: new beds, new chairs, new countertops, new everything.

Perfect spot in the Allston BU neighborhood. Just next to the Harvard Avenue "B line T Station." Central stop with lots of activity in the area. Plethora of amazing bars, lounges, cafes, & sandwich shops. Some of the best Korean & Mediterranean restaurants in Boston.

Fast wifi. Smart TV. Laundry in Basement.
neighborhood_overview:
This is the lively vibrant Allston neighborhood. The listing is close to Harvard Ave. and Comm. Ave intersection. Awesome places to eat, drink and hang out.

A quick walk to BU's West Campus and Agganis Arena.

Just steps away from Harvard Avenue "T" Stop.
host_about: I'm an American who has lived or traveled abroad mostly since 1998.  some of the places I've been: Boston is home right now. name: Enjoy Boston, Private Patio On Montgomery Park
description: Expertly furnished by a local designer and recently renovated, this delightful 2-bedroom condo features queen beds, a full bathroom, and an open-concept kitchen. The reverse layout has bedrooms on the entry level, with the kitchen and living room below. The living area, with a decorative fireplace, opens to a private patio leading to Montgomery Park, an exclusive gated green space. Come experience all that Boston's South End has to offer today.
neighborhood_overview:
The property is located in the vibrant South End, known for its historic charm and lively cultural scene. This area is celebrated for its beautifully preserved brownstones and 19th-century architecture, which line the picturesque streets. The South End offers a diverse culinary scene with trendy cafes, upscale restaurants, and excellent brunch spots. In addition to Montgomery Park, a private, gated green space, the neighborhood is close to other parks like the Boston Public Garden and the Esplanade, providing ample opportunities for outdoor activities.

Cultural attractions abound, with numerous art galleries, theaters, and local events contributing to the area's dynamic atmosphere. The South End also features a range of local amenities, including boutique shops, fitness centers, and grocery stores, all well-connected by public transportation and major roads. Known for its strong sense of community and diversity, the South End attracts professionals, families, and creatives,

name: Luxury6 - Harvard Avenue in Allston
description:
Enjoy a luxurious experience with a view at this centrally-located Home. 2024: Newly listed with brand new furnishings: new beds, chairs, countertops, etc.

Perfect spot in the Allston BU neighborhood. Just next to the intersection of Harvard Avenue and Cambridge Street. Plethora of amazing bars, lounges, cafes, & sandwich shops. Some of the best Korean & Mediterranean restaurants in Boston.

Fast wifi. Smart TV. Laundry in unit. Gym. Garage Parking. central AC/Heat. Elevator. And much more.
neighborhood_overview:
This is the lively vibrant Allston neighborhood. The listing is close to Harvard Avenue and Cambridge Street intersection. Awesome places to eat, drink and hang out.

A quick walk to BU's West Campus and Agganis Arena.

Also a quick walk to the shiny New "New Balance" complex called Boston Landing with a Bowling Alley restaurants and so much more.
host_about: I'm an American who has lived or traveled abroad mostly since 1998.  some of the places I've been: Boston is home right now. Been to: Saipan; Cairns, Australia; Beijing, Guiyang, and Chongching, China; Guam; Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto, and Fukuoka, Japan; Seoul, Busan, and Incheon, South Korea; Cebu, Philippines; most major cities in the USA; Cancun, Mexico; Dubai & Abu Dhabi, UAE... Hope to visit many more cities and countries soon.
